text: the men who stepped out on the red
carpet today are all in their 60s and in
their late 50s there's no one in the
next generation down
so effectively sit in ping has ditched
the rulebook that has governed these
very very sensitive issues of leadership
succession that have been put in place
over the past four decades the Communist
Party has a very poor record on this it
frightens itself it knows perfectly well
that when you've managed to control the
comrades the army cyberspace and
everything else you need to look behind
you at the other elite leader stalking
your corridor of power so they're all
frightened of each other and that's why
they set and place these rules but I
think what we've seen over the past few
days of the Congress is in a way what we
expected to see an enormous accretion of
power to see Jinping he doesn't need to
care so much about what every single
faction might think of him and so he can
sit on that pinnacle himself and not
invite a leader in waiting to sit up
there behind him potentially casting him
as a lame duck
you
